channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Your Business Could Sidestep Trump’s $100,000 H-1B Visa Fee
item.description: Even as companies digest the surprise White House announcement of $100,00 fees for H-1B visas for skilled foreign workers, companies are seeking worka...

item.title: Meta’s massive Louisiana data center needs a $3 billion power upgrade. Who should foot the bill?
item.description: In a rural corner of Louisiana, Meta is building one of the world’s largest data centers, a $10 billion behemoth as big as 70 football fields that wil...

item.title: Google backs $3 billion deal with Bitcoin miner as Big Tech looks to crypto for compute
item.description: Bitcoin miners have increasingly courted AI companies, which require large amounts of computing power to stay competitive.

item.title: U.S. economy grew more than expected in the second quarter at a 3.8% pace
item.description: An uptick in consumer spending helped the U.S. economy expand at a surprising 3.8% from April through June, the government reported in a dramatic upgr...

item.title: Home sales drop in August despite mortgage rate slide
item.description: Sales of previously occupied U.S. homes remained sluggish in August, even as a late-summer slide in mortgage rates brought home loan borrowing costs t...

item.title: Former Fed chairs Greenspan, Bernanke, and Yellen back Lisa Cook in Supreme Court case

item.title: ‘The frustration is overwhelming’: Soybean farmers feel betrayed as Argentina blows a hole in rural America’s $47 billion soybean bonanza
item.description: China will reportedly buy at least 10 cargoes of Argentine soybeans, further jeopardizing the U.S. export market, even as Argentina gobbles up Trump s...

item.title: SBA To Cut Fees For Small Manufacturers. Is This Tariff Help In Disguise?
item.description: The SBA has been intent on preserving the credibility of its loan programs. How can it afford to grant fee waivers?

item.title: Gen Z is so frugal they’re doctoring ‘heavy sodas’ at gas station fountains throughout the country to make one drink last all day
item.description: The heavy soda hack is being celebrated on TikTok, with users showcasing their creativity and thrift as points of pride.

item.title: Scott Bessent tells NYC to ‘drop dead’ while he arranges a $20b swap line for Argentina’s chainsaw-wielding, dog-cloning president
item.description: The Treasury Secretary looks at New York and sees a replay of the 1970s. He looks to Trump's ally in Argentina, and sees someone in need of rescue.

item.title: Not a single place in the U.S. made the cut for top retirement destinations—but experts warn to weigh these 3 factors before moving abroad
item.description: For those seeking sunshine, safety, and affordability, retiring abroad is more appealing than ever. But you should do your homework first.

item.title: This Sock Brand Shocked ‘Shark Tank’ Judges—and Landed a $500,000 Investment
item.description: Doublesoul co-founder Ben Rosenbaum got all five Sharks to bite, but closed a deal with Kendra Scott.

item.title: This Company Says 1 New AI Feature Can Handle 20 Hours of Work in Seconds
item.description: The Knot is bringing AI to wedding planning, and a new feature is designed to simplify one specific part of the process.

item.title: Why ‘Radical’ Leadership Styles Can Lead to Mediocre Performance
item.description: Angrily tearing down company processes and precedents in a hard-nosed hunt for better profits can work. But it’s more likely to cause harm.
